title: 107_s1591
content:
The "Nuclear Safety and Promotion Act of 2001" includes provisions for the growth of nuclear energy and NRC regulatory reform. It addresses Price Anderson reauthorization, elimination of foreign ownership restrictions, combined licenses, and environmental review. Additionally, it focuses on NRC regulatory reform, including antitrust review, hearing procedures, and decommissioning funding. The act also addresses the NRC personnel crisis by eliminating pension offset, establishing contracts with national laboratories, and implementing a training program. The "Nuclear Safety and Promotion Act of 2001" includes provisions for the growth of nuclear energy, Price-Anderson reauthorization, and elimination of foreign ownership restrictions. It also addresses NRC regulatory reform, antitrust review, hearing procedures, decommissioning funding, and the NRC personnel crisis. SEC. 102. ELIMINATION OF FOREIGN OWNERSHIP RESTRICTIONS. Amends sections of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 to remove certain sentences related to commercial licenses and medical therapy and research. SEC. 103. COMBINED LICENSE PERIODS. Amends the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 to specify the duration of the operating phase for combined construction and operating licenses. SEC. 104. SCOPE OF ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW. SEC. 104. SCOPE OF ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW. Amends Chapter 10 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 to specify the scope of environmental review. SEC. 110 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 states that in conducting any environmental review for a license application, the Commission should not consider the need for or alternatives to the facility to be licensed. Section 110 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 outlines the scope of environmental review for license applications, excluding the consideration of facility necessity or alternatives. Additionally, amendments are made to sections 57b and 131a, as well as section 202 of the Energy Reorganization Act of 1974, regarding licensing by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission and distribution of materials by the Department of Energy. This falls under Title II of NRC Regulatory Reform. SEC. 201. ELIMINATION OF DUPLICATIVE ANTITRUST REVIEW. Section 105 of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 is amended to streamline the process for granting licenses by allowing conditions imposed by the Commission to remain in effect until modified or removed. If a licensee applies for reconsideration of a condition, the Commission will expedite a proceeding to determine if the condition is necessary for compliance or should be modified. SEC. 202. HEARING PROCEDURES. A hearing under this section shall be conducted using informal adjudicatory procedures unless formal procedures are deemed necessary by the Commission to develop a sufficient record or achieve fairness. SEC. 203. AUTHORITY OVER FORMER LICENSEES FOR DECOMMISSIONING FUNDING. SEC. 203. AUTHORITY OVER FORMER LICENSEES FOR DECOMMISSIONING FUNDING. Amends the Atomic Energy Act to ensure sufficient funds for decommissioning licensed facilities. TITLE III--NRC PERSONNEL CRISIS

SEC. 301. ELIMINATION OF PENSION OFFSET. Amends the Atomic Energy Act to exempt certain annuitants from pension offset when hired as consultants by the Commission.

SEC. 302. CONTRACTS WITH THE NATIONAL LABORATORIES. SEC. 302 amends the Atomic Energy Act to allow the Commission to enter contracts with national laboratories, with measures to mitigate conflicts of interest. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission will implement a training program to address shortages in critical safety skills in nuclear sciences, health physics, and engineering fields. $1,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2002 to 2005 for this program.
